title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.1 - Fees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.1 - Fees

State Regulations
(a) A sheriff, marshal, trustee, receiver, executor, etc., to sell alcoholic beverages in his
possession under a court order--$20 single transaction. (b) A steamship or aircraft company to
purchase alcoholic beverages from a manufacturer or wholesaler for consumption
outside the territorial jurisdiction of the State: (1)
for a steamship vessel, $20 single
transaction; $200 annual; (2)
for
aircraft, $20 single transaction; $200 annual. (c) A manufacturer of non-beverage products
to purchase alcoholic beverages from a licensed wholesaler or manufacturer when
intended for use in the manufacture of products unfit for consumption such as
for flavoring, cooking, etc., $20 single transaction; $200 annual. (d) A fire insurance or fire salvage company
to sell alcoholic beverages in its possession as a result of fire on licensed
premises, $20 single transaction. (e) A hospital to purchase alcoholic
beverages from a manufacturer or wholesaler for medicinal use, $20
annual. (f) A licensee or former
licensee to sell his stock of alcoholic beverages to another licensee when such
licensee or former licensee liquidates his business, $20 single
transaction. (g) A warehouseman, railroad, steamship company, etc., to sell alcoholic beverages on which it has
acquired a lien by statute, $20 single transaction. (h) A bank to sell warehouse receipts on
alcoholic beverages which have come into its possession as a result of default
in paying of a loan made by the bank to a licensee, $20 single
transaction. (i) An out-of-state
manufacturer or wholesaler to negotiate with one or more wholesale licensees in
this State to establish one or more operating agency relationships for the
distribution of its products, $20 single transaction where negotiation with a
single wholesale licensee is authorized; $200 for an annual permit authorizing
negotiations with more than one wholesale licensee. (j) To purchase, receive, or sell alcoholic
beverages in cases not expressly provided for by the Alcoholic Beverage Control

Law, $20. (k) A summer licensee to
store alcoholic beverages on the premises between the expiration of the license
period and the issuance of a new license for such premises for the following
license period, $20 for each 20 cases or fraction thereof. (l) The application must be accompanied by
check or draft in the amount of the prescribed fee, payable to the State Liquor

Authority. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
33.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
